CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph Wright, 27 Bigger Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Which do you think people give priority recognition to, the acquisition of money or achievement?" answer reads: "I think that the man who did something to receive an award or a medal because of some good deed receives more recognition."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Wright, wearing eyeglasses, light colored coat with lapels and button cuffs, v-neck sweater, and dark hat with band, standing in front of light colored marble wall, left store window displaying mens dress shirts and neckties, and right store window displaying female undergarments
